title: 103_hr2307
content: The Act is titled the "Workers' Political Rights Act" and includes limitations on contributions and expenditures by labor organizations. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" limits contributions and expenditures by labor organizations. Amendments to the Federal Election Campaign Act include requirements for labor organizations to provide written notification to employees annually and upon employment commencement. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" mandates labor organizations to inform employees annually and upon employment commencement that they cannot be forced to pay for the organization's political activities or join the organization. The "Workers' Political Rights Act" ensures that employees cannot be compelled to join a labor organization or pay for its political activities. Employees can choose to pay an agency fee instead of membership dues, limited to the cost of exclusive representation services. Full members have the right to pay dues and enjoy membership benefits. The employee's collective bargaining unit covers bargaining, contract administration, and grievance adjustment. Full members of the labor organization can reduce their dues by their share of political spending. The organization's exclusive representation costs and political spending are based on the previous fiscal year. Details on membership dues, initiation fees, and assessments for the current year are provided. The labor organization must provide an annual examination by an independent certified public accountant of financial statements to verify claimed expenditures were actually made for certain expenses. This examination must adhere to generally accepted auditing standards. The labor organization must maintain procedures to determine costs properly chargeable to agency fee payors for exclusive representation. Any challenges to these costs must be resolved by a mutually selected impartial decisionmaker, subject to review by the National Labor Relations Board. Challenges to these costs are resolved by a mutually selected impartial decisionmaker, subject to review by the National Labor Relations Board. Labor organizations not meeting certain requirements must finance expenditures with funds legally collected under the Act for a separate segregated fund. The amendments made by section 2 of the Act will apply to contributions and expenditures made after the enactment date.
